In the name of God Amen, this twenty fourth day of December anno 1672
I Matthew Stone of Charles County in the province of Maryland planter being sick of
body but of good and perfect memory thanks bee to God and calling to mind
the Estate of this transitory life and that all flesh must yield unto
Death
Death [unknown] it shall please God to call do make Constitute ordaine and Declare this to bee my last will and testament in manner and form Following First being [pertinant?] and [unclear] from the bottom of my heart For my [sens?] past humbly desiring forgiveness for the same I give and Commit my soule unto Allmighty God my savior and redeemer in whome and by the merits of Jesus Christ Death and passion [unclear] and inherit the Kingdom of Heaven prepared for his Elect and [Chosen?] amd my body to bee buried in such place where it shall please my Executors hereafter named to appoint, and for the settleing of my temporal Estate. I do order give disperse of the same in manner and form following That is to say first I will that all those Debts which I owe in right or [Conocieve?] to any manner of person or persons whatsoever shall be well And truly satisfied contented and paid in som Convenient time after my [unclear] by my Executor hereafter named.
